Convex Analysis (Rockafellar, 1970) -- Chapter 03 -- Section 15 -- Part 8

section Chap03section Section15open scoped BigOperatorsopen scoped Pointwiseopen scoped Topologyopen Filter

The Euclidean norm scales linearly with scalar multiplication.

lemma piEuclideanNorm_smul {n : } (r : ) (x : Fin n ) : Real.sqrt (dotProduct (r x) (r x)) = |r| * Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) := by have hr2 : 0 r * r := by nlinarith calc Real.sqrt (dotProduct (r x) (r x)) = Real.sqrt (r * r * dotProduct x x) := by simp [dotProduct_smul, smul_eq_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm] _ = Real.sqrt (r * r) * Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) := by simpa [mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc] using (Real.sqrt_mul hr2 (dotProduct x x)) _ = |r| * Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) := by have h : Real.sqrt (r * r) = |r| := by simpa [pow_two] using (Real.sqrt_sq_eq_abs r) simp [h]

Comparison of the sup norm with the Euclidean norm on Fin sorry : TypeFin Unknown identifier `n`n .

lemma supNorm_le_piEuclideanNorm_and_piEuclideanNorm_le_sqrt_n_mul_supNorm {n : } (x : Fin n ) : x Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) Real.sqrt (n : ) * x := by constructor have hnonneg : 0 Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) := Real.sqrt_nonneg _ refine (pi_norm_le_iff_of_nonneg (x := x) (r := Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x)) hnonneg).2 ?_ intro i have hnonneg' : j (Finset.univ : Finset (Fin n)), 0 (x j) ^ 2 := by intro j hj nlinarith have hmem : i (Finset.univ : Finset (Fin n)) := by simp have hsum : (x i) ^ 2 j (Finset.univ : Finset (Fin n)), (x j) ^ 2 := Finset.single_le_sum hnonneg' hmem have hsq : (x i) ^ 2 dotProduct x x := by simpa [dotProduct, pow_two, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc] using hsum have habs : |x i| Real.sqrt (dotProduct x x) := Real.abs_le_sqrt hsq simpa using habs have hcoord : i, x i x := by have h := (pi_norm_le_iff_of_nonneg (x := x) (r := x) (norm_nonneg _)).1 (le_rfl) simpa using h have hterm : i, x i * x i x ^ 2 := by intro i have habs : |x i| x := by simpa using hcoord i have hsq : |x i| * |x i| x * x := by exact mul_self_le_mul_self (abs_nonneg _) habs simpa [pow_two, abs_mul_abs_self] using hsq have hsum : dotProduct x x (n : ) * x ^ 2 := by have hsum' : i : Fin n, x i * x i i : Fin n, x ^ 2 := by refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro i hi exact hterm i have hsum'' : i : Fin n, x ^ 2 = (n : ) * x ^ 2 := by classical simp have hsum''' : i : Fin n, x i * x i (n : ) * x ^ 2 := by simpa [hsum''] using hsum' simpa [dotProduct] using hsum''' have hnonneg : 0 Real.sqrt (n : ) * x := by exact mul_nonneg (Real.sqrt_nonneg _) (norm_nonneg _) have hEq : (Real.sqrt (n : ) * x) ^ 2 = (n : ) * x ^ 2 := by have hn : 0 (n : ) := by exact_mod_cast (Nat.zero_le n) calc (Real.sqrt (n : ) * x) ^ 2 = (Real.sqrt (n : ) * Real.sqrt (n : )) * (x * x) := by ring _ = (n : ) * x ^ 2 := by simp [pow_two, Real.mul_self_sqrt hn] have hsq : dotProduct x x (Real.sqrt (n : ) * x) ^ 2 := by simpa [hEq] using hsum exact (Real.sqrt_le_iff).2 hnonneg, hsq

Text 15.0.20: An extended-real-valued convex function is gauge-like if and all its sublevel sets {x | sorry sorry} : Set ?m.1{x | Unknown identifier `f`f x Unknown identifier ``} for are proportional, i.e. each is a positive scalar multiple of any other such sublevel set.

def IsGaugeLike {n : } (f : (Fin n ) EReal) : Prop := ConvexFunctionOn (S := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n ))) f f 0 = sInf (Set.range f) : EReal, f 0 < < f 0 < < t : , 0 < t {x | f x } = t {x | f x }

Sublevel sets of a gauge-like function are homothetic.

A gauge is closed if its epigraph over Unknown identifier `univ`univ is closed.

def IsClosedGauge {n : } (k : (Fin n ) EReal) : Prop := IsGauge k IsClosed (epigraph (S := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n ))) k)

The support function of a nonempty convex set containing 0 : 0 is a closed gauge.

A function is gauge-like closed proper convex if it is gauge-like and is a closed proper convex EReal : TypeEReal-valued function on (modeled as Fin sorry : TypeFin Unknown identifier `n`n ).

def IsGaugeLikeClosedProperConvex {n : } (f : (Fin n ) EReal) : Prop := IsGaugeLike f ClosedConvexFunction f ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n )) f
